compression.guidance:
Set compression level
Range of parameters : CompressionLevel>=0 && CompressionLevel<=4

set.guidance:
Set parameters for the 1D histogram of given id:
nbins; valMin; valMax; unit; function; binScheme

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the 1D histogram of given id

setAscii.guidance:
Print 1D histogram of given id on ascii file.
Range of parameters : id>=0

setPlotting.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of the 1D histogram of given id

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 1D histogram of given id

setX.guidance:
Set parameters for the 1D histogram of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 1D histogram of given id

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 1D histogram of given id

set.guidance:
Set parameters for the 2D histogram of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme
nybins; yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction; ybinScheme

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 2D histogram of given id

setX.guidance:
Set parameters for the 2D histogram of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 2D histogram of given id

setY.guidance:
Set parameters for the 2D histogram of given id:
nybins; yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction; ybinScheme

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 2D histogram of given id

setZaxis.guidance: Set z-axis title for the 2D histogram of given id

set.guidance:
Set parameters for the 3D histogram of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme
nybins; yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction; ybinScheme
nzbins; zvalMin; zvalMax; zunit; zfunction; zbinScheme

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the 3D histogram of given id

setAscii.guidance:
Print 3D histogram of given id on ascii file.
Range of parameters : id>=0

setPlotting.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of the 3D histogram of given id

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 3D histogram of given id

setX.guidance:
Set parameters for the 3D histogram of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 3D histogram of given id

setY.guidance:
Set parameters for the 3D histogram of given id:
nybins; yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction; ybinScheme

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 3D histogram of given id

setZaxis.guidance: Set z-axis title for the 3D histogram of given id

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the ntuple of given id

set.guidance:
Set parameters for the 1D profile of given id:
nbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme
yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the 1D profile of given id

setAscii.guidance:
Print 1D profile of given id on ascii file.
Range of parameters : id>=0

setPlotting.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of the 1D profile of given id

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 1D profile of given id

setX.guidance:
Set parameters for the 1D profile of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 1D profile of given id

setY.guidance:
Set parameters for the 1D profile of #id:
yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; yfunction

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 1D profile of given id

set.guidance:
Set parameters for the 2D profile of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xbinScheme
nybins; yvalMin; yvalMax; yunit; ybinScheme
zvalMin; zvalMax; zunit; zfunction

setActivation.guidance: Set activation for the 2D profile of given id

setAscii.guidance:
Print 2D profile of given id on ascii file.
Range of parameters : id>=0

setPlotting.guidance: (In)Activate batch plotting of the 2D profile of given id

setTitle.guidance: Set title for the 2D profile of given id

setX.guidance:
Set parameters for the 2D profile of given id:
nxbins; xvalMin; xvalMax; xunit; xfunction; xbinScheme

setXaxis.guidance: Set x-axis title for the 2D profile of given id

setYaxis.guidance: Set y-axis title for the 2D profile of given id

setZ.guidance:
Set parameters for the 2D profile of #id:
zvalMin; zvalMax; zunit; zfunction

setZaxis.guidance: Set z-axis title for the 2D profile of given id

setDimensions.guidance: Set the plotter window size (width and height) in pixels.

setLayout.guidance:
Set page layout (number of columns and rows per page).
Suported layouts:
columns = 1 .. 2
rows    = 1 .. 3 and  >= columns

setStyle.guidance:
Only one plotting style is available in low resolution:
inlib_default: PAW style with low resolution fonts

setActivation.guidance:
Set activation.
When this option is enabled, only the histograms marked as activated
are returned, filled or saved on file.
No warning is issued when Get or Fill is called on inactive histogram.

setFileName.guidance: Set name for the histograms & ntuple file

setHistoDirName.guidance: Set name for the histograms directory

setNtupleDirName.guidance: Set name for the ntuple directory

verbose.guidance:
Set verbose level
Range of parameters : VerboseLevel>=0 && VerboseLevel<=4

add.guidance:
Define a new alias as the sum of two values.
Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2>
<new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,
aliased value is alternated.

alias.guidance:
Set an alias.
String can be aliased by this command.
The string may contain one or more spaces,
the string must be enclosed by double quotes (").
To use an alias, enclose the alias name with
parenthis "{" and "}".

ignoreInitializationCout.guidance:
Omit cout from threads during initialization, as they should be identical to the masther thread.
This command takes effect only if cout destination is screen without buffering.
This command does not affect to cerr.

ignoreThreadsExcept.guidance:
Omit cout from threads except the specified one.
This command takes effect only if cout destination is screen without buffering.
If specified thread ID is greater than the number of threads,
no cout is displayed from worker threads. -1 to reset.
This command does not affect to cerr.

prefixString.guidance: Set the prefix string for each cout/cerr line from a thread.

setCerrFile.guidance:
Send G4cerr stream to a file dedicated to a thread.
To have a display output, use special keyword "**Screen**".
If append flag is true output is appended to file,
otherwise file output is overwritten.

setCoutFile.guidance:
Send G4cout stream to a file dedicated to a thread.
To have a display output, use special keyword "**Screen**".
If append flag is true output is appended to file,
otherwise file output is overwritten.

useBuffer.guidance:
Send cout and/or cerr stream to a buffer.
The buffered text will be printed at the end of the job
for each thread at a time, so that output of each thread is grouped.
This command has no effect if output goes to a file.

createHTML.guidance:
Generate HTML files for all of sub-directories and commands.
Directory path should be given by FULL-PATH.

divide.guidance:
Define a new alias as the division of two values.
Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2>
<new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,
aliased value is alternated.

doif.guidance:
Execute a macro file if the expression is true.
Syntax : <double> <comp> <double> <UI_command>

foreach.guidance:
Execute a macro file more than once.
Loop counter can be used as an aliased variable.
Values must be separated by a space.

getEnv.guidance: Get a shell environment variable and define it as an alias.

getVal.guidance:
Get the current value of the UI command and define it as an alias.
Command is ignored if the UI command does not support GetCurrentValue().
Syntax : <alias_name> <UI_command>

if.guidance:
Execute a macro file if the expression is true.
Syntax : <double> <comp> <double> <macro_file>

loop.guidance:
Execute a macro file more than once.
Loop counter can be used as an aliased variable.

macroPath.guidance: Set macro search pathwith colon-separated list.

manual.guidance:
Display all of sub-directories and commands.
Directory path should be given by FULL-PATH.

phi.guidance:
Define phi range.
Usage : /control/matScan/phi [nbin] [phiMin] [phiSpan] [unit]
Notation of angles :
phi   --- +X axis : 0 deg. / +Y axis : 90 deg. / -X axis : 180 deg. / -Y axis : 270 deg.

region.guidance:
Define region name to be scanned.
/control/matScan/regionSensitive command is automatically
set to TRUE with this command.

regionSensitive.guidance:
Set region sensitivity.
This command is automatically set to TRUE
if /control/matScan/region command is issued.

scan.guidance:
Start material scanning.
Scanning range should be defined with
/control/matScan/theta and /control/matSca/phi commands.

singleMeasure.guidance:
Measure thickness for one particular direction.
Notation of angles :
theta --- +Z axis : +90 deg. / X-Y plane : 0 deg. / -Z axis : -90 deg.
phi   --- +X axis : 0 deg. / +Y axis : 90 deg. / -X axis : 180 deg. / -Y axis : 270 deg.

singleTo.guidance: Measure thicknesss for one direction defined by a unit vector.

theta.guidance:
Define theta range.
Usage : /control/matScan/theta [nbin] [thetaMin] [thetaSpan] [unit]
Notation of angles :
theta --- +Z axis : +90 deg. / X-Y plane : 0 deg. / -Z axis : -90 deg.

maximumStoredHistory.guidance: Set maximum number of stored UI commands.

multiply.guidance:
Define a new alias as the multiplification of two values.
Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2>
<new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,
aliased value is alternated.

remainder.guidance:
Define a new alias as the remainder of two values.
Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2>
<new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,
aliased value is alternated.

saveHistory.guidance:
Store command history to a file.
Defaul file name is G4history.macro.

subtract.guidance:
Define a new alias as the subtraction of two values.
Syntax : <new_alias> <value1> <value2>
<new_alias> may be an already existing alias. If it is the case,
aliased value is alternated.

suppressAbortion.guidance:
Suppress the program abortion caused by G4Exception.
Suppression level = 0 : no suppression
= 1 : suppress during EventProc state
= 2 : full suppression, i.e. no abortion by G4Exception
When abortion is suppressed, you will get error messages issued by G4Exception,
and there is NO guarantee for the correct result after the G4Exception error message.
Range of parameters : level >= 0 && level <= 2

verbose.guidance:
Applied command will also be shown on screen.
This command is useful with MACRO file.
0 : silent
1 : only the valid commands are shown.
2 : comment lines are also shown (default).
Range of parameters : switch >= 0 && switch <=2

setHighEdge.guidance:
Set high edge energy value
Range of parameters : edge >0.0

setLowEdge.guidance:
Set low edge energy value
Range of parameters : edge >0.0

setMaxCutEnergy.guidance:
Set maximum of cut energy value
Range of parameters : cut >0.0

verbose.guidance:
Set the Verbose level of G4ProductionCutsTable.
0 : Silent (default)
1 : Display warning messages
2 : Display more info
2 : Display debug info
Range of parameters : level >=0 && level <=3

keepCurrentEvent.guidance:
Store the current event to G4Run object instead of deleting it at the end of event.
Stored event is available through G4Run until the begining of next run.
Given the potential large memory size of G4Event and its datamember objects stored in G4Event,
the user must be careful and responsible for not to store too many G4Event objects.

clear.guidance:
Clear stacked tracks.
2 : clear all tracks in all stacks
1 : clear tracks in the urgent and waiting stacks
0 : clear tracks in the waiting stack (default)
-1 : clear tracks in the urgent stack
-2 : clear tracks in the postponed stack
Range of parameters : level>=-2&&level<=2

status.guidance: List current status of the stack.

verbose.guidance:
Set verbose level for G4StackManager
0 : Silence (default)
1 : Minimum statistics
2 : Detailed reports
Note - this value is overwritten by /event/verbose command.

Set Verbose level of event management category.
0 : Silent
1 : Stacking information
2 : More...
Range of parameters : level>=0

check_mode.guidance:
Set navigator in -check_mode- state.
This will cause extra checks to be applied during
navigation. More strict and less tolerant conditions
are applied. A run-time performance penalty may be
observed when the -check_mode- state is activated.
NOTE: this command has effect -only- if Geant4 has
been installed with the G4VERBOSE flag set!

push_notify.guidance:
Set navigator verbosity push notifications.
This allows to disable/re-enable verbosity in
navigation, when tracks may get stuck and require
one artificial push along the direction by the
navigator. Notification is active by default.
NOTE: this command has effect -only- if Geant4 has
been installed with the G4VERBOSE flag set!

reset.guidance:
Reset navigator and navigation history.
NOTE: must be called only after kernel has been
initialized once through the run manager!

verbose.guidance:
Set run-time verbosity for the navigator.
0 : Silent (default)
1 : Display volume positioning and step lengths
2 : Display step/safety info on point location
3 : Display minimal state at -every- step
4 : Maximum verbosity (very detailed!)
NOTE: this command has effect -only- if Geant4 has
been installed with the G4VERBOSE flag set!
Range of parameters : level >=0 && level <=4

maximum_errors.guidance:
Set the maximum number of overlap errors to report
for each single volume being checked.
Once reached the maximum number specified, overlaps
affecting that volume further than that are simply ignored.

recursion_depth.guidance:
Set the depth in the geometry tree for recursion.
recursive_test will then stop after reached the specified depth.
By default, recursion will proceed for the whole depth.

recursion_start.guidance:
Set the initial level in the geometry tree for recursion.
recursive_test will then start from the specified level.

resolution.guidance:
Set the number of points on surface to be generated for
checking overlaps.

run.guidance:
Start running the recursive overlap check.
Volumes are recursively asked to verify for overlaps
for points generated on the surface against their
respective mother volume and sisters at the same
level, performing for all daughters and daughters of
daughters, etc.
NOTE: it may take a very long time,
depending on the geometry complexity !

tolerance.guidance:
Define tolerance (in mm) by which overlaps reports
should be reported. By default, all overlaps are
reported, i.e. tolerance is set to: 0*mm.

verbosity.guidance:
Specify if running in verbosity mode or not.
By default verbosity is set to ON (TRUE).

focuspoint.guidance: Set the focusing point for the beam

rot1.guidance:
Sets the 1st vector for angular distribution rotation matrix
Need not be a unit vector
Range of parameters : AR1x != 0 || AR1y != 0 || AR1z != 0

rot2.guidance:
Sets the 2nd vector for angular distribution rotation matrix
Need not be a unit vector
Range of parameters : AR2x != 0 || AR2y != 0 || AR2z != 0

sigma_r.guidance: Set standard deviation in direction for 1D beam.

sigma_x.guidance: Set standard deviation in direction in x-direc. for 2D beam

sigma_y.guidance: Set standard deviation in direction in y-direc. for 2D beam

surfnorm.guidance:
Makes a user-defined distribution with respect to surface normals rather than x,y,z axes.
Default is false

type.guidance:
Sets angular source distribution type
Possible variables are: iso, cos, planar, beam1d, beam2d, focused or user

user_coor.guidance:
true for using user defined angular co-ordinates
Default is false

direction.guidance:
Set momentum direction.
Direction needs not to be a unit vector.
Angular distribution type is set to planar.
Range of parameters : Px != 0 || Py != 0 || Pz != 0

alpha.guidance: Sets Alpha (index) for power-law energy dist.

biasAlpha.guidance: Set the power-law index for the energy sampling distri. )

calculate.guidance: Calculates the distributions for Cdg and BBody

diffspec.guidance: True for differential and flase for integral spectra

emspec.guidance: True for energy and false for momentum spectra

ezero.guidance: Sets E_0 for exponential distribution (in MeV)

gradient.guidance: Sets the gradient for Lin distribution (in 1/MeV)

intercept.guidance: Sets the intercept for Lin distributions (in MeV)

mono.guidance: Sets a monocromatic energy (same as  gps/energy)

sigma.guidance: Sets the standard deviation for Gaussian energy dist.

temp.guidance: Sets the temperature for Brem and BBody distributions (in Kelvin)

file.guidance: import the arb energy hist in an ASCII file

inter.guidance: Sets the interpolation method for arbitrary distribution.

point.guidance:
Allows user to define a histogram
Enter: Ehi Weight
Range of parameters : Ehi >= 0. && Weight >= 0.

ion.guidance:
Set properties of ion to be generated.
[usage] /gps/ion Z A Q E
Z:(int) AtomicNumber
A:(int) AtomicMass
Q:(int) Charge of Ion (in unit of e)
E:(double) Excitation energy (in keV)

ionLvl.guidance:
Set properties of ion to be generated.
[usage] /gps/ion Z A Q Lvl
Z:(int) AtomicNumber
A:(int) AtomicMass
Q:(int) Charge of Ion (in unit of e)
Lvl:(int) Number of metastable state excitation level (0-9)

number.guidance:
Set number of particles to be generated per vertex.
Range of parameters : N>0

particle.guidance:
Set particle to be generated.
(geantino is default)
(ion can be specified for shooting ions)

confine.guidance:
Confine source to volume (NULL to unset).
usage: confine VolName

halfx.guidance: Set x half length of source.

halfy.guidance: Set y half length of source.

halfz.guidance: Set z half length of source.

inner_radius.guidance: Set inner radius of source when required.

paralp.guidance: Angle from y-axis of y' in Para

parphi.guidance: Azimuth angle through centres of z faces

parthe.guidance: Polar angle through centres of z faces

rot1.guidance:
Set the 1st vector defining the rotation matrix'.
It does not need to be a unit vector.
Range of parameters : R1x != 0 || R1y != 0 || R1z != 0

rot2.guidance:
Set the 2nd vector defining the rotation matrix'.
It does not need to be a unit vector.
Range of parameters : R2x != 0 || R2y != 0 || R2z != 0

shape.guidance: Sets source shape for Plan, Surface or Volume type source.

sigma_r.guidance:
Set standard deviation in radial of the beam positional profile
applicable to Beam type source only

sigma_x.guidance:
Set standard deviation of beam positional profile in x-dir
applicable to Beam type source only

sigma_y.guidance:
Set standard deviation of beam positional profile in y-dir
applicable to Beam type source only

type.guidance:
Sets source distribution type.
Either Point, Beam, Plane, Surface or Volume

position.guidance:
Set starting position of the particle for a Point like source.
Same effect as the two /gps/pos/type Point /gps/pos/centre commands.

add.guidance:
add a new source defintion to the particle gun with the specified intensity
Range of parameters : addsource > 0.

clear.guidance: Remove all the defined particle sources

delete.guidance:
delete the indexed source from the list
Range of parameters : deletesource > 0

flatsampling.guidance:
true for applying flat (biased) sampling among the sources
Default is false

intensity.guidance:
reset the current source to the specified intensity
Range of parameters : setintensity > 0.

multiplevertex.guidance:
true for simulaneous generation mutiple vertex
Default is false

set.guidance:
set the indexed source as the current one
so one can change its source definition
Range of parameters : setsource >= 0

show.guidance: Show the current source index and intensity

time.guidance: Set initial time of the particle.

verbose.guidance:
Set Verbose level for GPS
0 : Silent
1 : Limited information
2 : Detailed information
Range of parameters : level>=0 && level <=2

addIcon.guidance:
Add a non-checkable icon to the Icon toolbar.
If the Icon parameter is set to "user_icon", you should provide the icon file in xpm format, otherwise you have to choose one of the candidate icons
A command given without parameters will display a window that will allow one to choose the parameters (if needed) for this command.
E.g: /gui/addIcon "Change background color" user_icon /vis/viewer/set/background ../Images/background.xpm
Special cases for the Icon parameter:
- open: Open an open-file-selector that can run the Command with File as argument.
- save: Open a save-file-selector that can run the Command with File as argument.
- move/rotate/pick/zoom_in/zoom_out: Theses icons are radio-button icons that can change cursor action.
- wireframe/solid/hidden_line_removal/hidden_line_and_surface_removal: These icons are radio-button icons that can change drawing style.
- perspective/ortho: These icons are radio-button icons that can change projection style.

addMenu.guidance: Add a menu to menu bar.

system.guidance: Send a command to the system.

direction.guidance:
Set momentum direction.
Direction needs not to be a unit vector.
Range of parameters : ex != 0 || ey != 0 || ez != 0

ion.guidance:
Set properties of ion to be generated.
[usage] /gun/ion Z A Q
Z:(int) AtomicNumber
A:(int) AtomicMass
Q:(int) Charge of Ion (in unit of e)
E:(double) Excitation energy (in keV)

ionL.guidance:
Set properties of ion to be generated.
[usage] /gun/ion Z A Q I
Z:(int) AtomicNumber
A:(int) AtomicMass
Q:(int) Charge of Ion (in unit of e)
I:(int) Level number of metastable state (0 = ground)

momentum.guidance:
Set momentum. This command is equivalent to two commands /gun/direction and /gun/momentumAmp
Range of parameters : px != 0 || py != 0 || pz != 0

momentumAmp.guidance:
Set absolute value of momentum.
Direction should be set by /gun/direction command.
This command should be used alternatively with /gun/energy.

number.guidance:
Set number of particles to be generated.
Range of parameters : N>0

particle.guidance:
Set particle to be generated.
(geantino is default)
(ion can be specified for shooting ions)

position.guidance: Set starting position of the particle.

time.guidance: Set initial time of the particle.

processAbsLevel.guidance: Set absolute energy level (with unit) of allowed energy non-conservation

processRelLevel.guidance: Set relative level of allowed energy non-conservation

reportLevel.guidance:
Set level of detail reported upon E/p non-conservation
0 - (default) no reporting
1 - report only when E/p not conserved
2 - report regardless of E/p conservation
3 - report only when E/p not conserved, with names, limits
4 - report regardless of E/p conservation, with names, limits
Range of parameters : ReportLevel >= 0 && ReportLevel < 5

verbose.guidance: Set the Verbose level.

printDensityEffParam.guidance:
print Material from G4DensityEffectData.
all - all materials

printElement.guidance:
print Element from G4ElementTable.
all - all elements.

printMaterial.guidance:
print Material from G4MaterialTable.
all - all materials

listMaterials.guidance:
Materials in Geant4 dataBase.
simple - simple NIST materials.
compound - compound NIST materials.
hep - HEP materials.
bio - biomedical materials.
all - list of all Geant4 materials.

printElement.guidance:
print element(s) in dataBase.
symbol = element.
all    = all elements.

printElementZ.guidance:
print element Z in dataBase.
0 = all elements.
Range of parameters : 0<=Z && Z<108

verbose.guidance: Set verbose level.

level_tolerance.guidance:
Set tolerance in level seaching.
Unit of the energy can be :
MeV, keV, eV (default)
Range of parameters : lTolerance >0.0

min_halflife.guidance:
Set threshold of half-life.
Unit of the time can be :
s, ms, ns (default)
Range of parameters : life >0.0

activate.guidance:
Activate process
Activate [process index]
Range of parameters : index >=0

dump.guidance:
dump process manager or process information
dump [process index]
process index: -1 for process manager

inactivate.guidance:
Inactivate process
inactivate [process index]
Range of parameters : index >=0

verbose.guidance:
Set Verbose Level for Process or Process Manager
Verbose [Verbose] [process index]
process index: -1 for process manager

br.guidance:
Set branching ratio. [0< BR <1.0]
Range of parameters : (br >=0.0) && (br <=1.0)

select.guidance:
Enter index of decay mode.
Range of parameters : mode >=0

lifetime.guidance:
Set life time.
Unit of the time can be :
s, ms, ns (default)
Range of parameters : life >0.0

stable.guidance:
Set stable flag.
false: Unstable   true: Stable

verbose.guidance:
Set Verbose level of particle property.
0 : Silent (default)
1 : Display warning messages
2 : Display more
Range of parameters : verbose_level >=0

Set Verbose level of particle table.
0 : Silent (default)
1 : Display warning messages
2 : Display more
Range of parameters : verbose_level >=0

SyncRadiationAll.guidance: Switching on/off synchrotron radiation for all charged.

activate.guidance:
Activate processes
Activate  name [particle]
name:     process name or type name
particle: particle name [all: for all particles]

dump.guidance:
Dump process information
dump name [particle]
name:     process name or type name
particle: particle name [all: for all particles]

LambdaFactor.guidance: Set lambdaFactor parameter for integral option

StepFunction.guidance:
Set the energy loss step limitation parameters.
dRoverR   : max Range variation per step
finalRange: range for final step

binsDEDX.guidance: Set number of bins for EM tables

binsLambda.guidance: Set number of bins for EM tables

binsPerDecade.guidance: Set number of bins per decade for EM tables

maxKinEnergy.guidance: Set the max kinetic energy for EM tables

maxKinEnergyCSDA.guidance: Set the max kinetic energy for CSDA table

minKinEnergy.guidance: Set the min kinetic energy for EM tables

useCutAsFinalRange.guidance: Enable?disable use of cut in range as a final range

verbose.guidance: Set verbose level for EM physics

AddDNARegion.guidance:
Activate DNA in the G4Region.
regName   : G4Region name
dnaType   : opt0, opt1, opt2

AddMicroElecRegion.guidance: Activate MicroElec model in the G4Region

AddPAIRegion.guidance:
Activate PAI in the G4Region.
partName  : particle name (default - all)
regName   : G4Region name
paiType   : PAI, PAIphoton

applyCuts.guidance: Enable/disable applying cuts for gamma processes

augerCascade.guidance: Enable/disable simulation of cascade of Auger electrons

deexcitation.guidance:
Set deexcitation flags per G4Region.
regName   : G4Region name
flagFluo  : Fluorescence
flagAuger : Auger
flagPIXE  : PIXE

deexcitationIgnoreCut.guidance: Enable/Disable usage of cuts in de-excitation module

fluoBearden.guidance: Enable/disable usage of Bearden fluorescence files

lowestElectronEnergy.guidance: Set the lowest kinetic energy for e+-

lowestMuHadEnergy.guidance: Set the lowest kinetic energy for muons and hadrons

pixeElecXSmodel.guidance: The name of PIXE cross section for electron

pixeXSmodel.guidance: The name of PIXE cross section

setBiasingFactor.guidance:
Set factor for the process cross section.
procName   : process name
procFact   : factor
flagFact   : flag to change weight

setForcedInteraction.guidance:
Set factor for the process cross section.
procNam    : process name
regNam     : region name
tlength    : fixed target length
tflag      : flag to change weight

setSecBiasing.guidance:
Set bremsstrahlung or delta-e- splitting/Russian roullette per region.
bProcNam : process name
bRegNam  : region name
bFactor  : number of splitted gamma or probability of Russian roulette
bEnergy  : max energy of a secondary for this biasing method
unit of energy

spline.guidance: Enable/disable usage spline for Physics Vectors

verbose.guidance: Set verbose level for EM physics

workerVerbose.guidance: Set worker verbose level for EM physics

nuclearRadiusScale.guidance: Set length scale for nuclear model

piNAbsorption.guidance: Probability for pion absorption on single nucleon

randomFile.guidance: Save random-engine to file at each interaction

shadowningRadius.guidance: Effective nucleon radius for trailing effect

showHistory.guidance: Collect and report full structure of cascade

useBestNuclearModel.guidance: Use all physical-units for nuclear structure

verbose.guidance: Enable information messages

do_not_adjust_final_state.guidance: Disable to adjust final state for getting better conservation.

neglect_Doppler_broadening.guidance:
Switch off the Doppler broadening due to the thermal motion of the target nucleus.
This option provides a significant CPU performance advantage.

skip_missing_isotopes.guidance:
Use only exact isotope data files, instead of allowing nearby isotope files to be used.
In this case if the exact file is not available, the cross section will be set to zero.

use_photo_evaporation.guidance: Force the use of the Photon Evaporation model, instead of the neutron capture final state data.

verbose.guidance:
Set Verbose level of ParticleHP package
Range of parameters : verbose_level >=0

inactivate.guidance:
Inactivate process
Inactivate processes
Inactivate  name [particle]
name:     process name or type name
particle: particle name [all: for all particles]

list.guidance:
List up process names
list [type]
type: process type [all:for all proceeses]

FactorForAngleLimit.guidance:
Set factor for computation of a limit for -t (invariant trasfer)
Range of parameters : Fact>0

GeomFactor.guidance:
Set GeomFactor parameter for msc processes
Range of parameters : Fg>0

MuHadLateralDisplacement.guidance: Enable/disable sampling of lateral displacement for muons and hadrons

RangeFactor.guidance:
Set RangeFactor for msc processes of e+-
Range of parameters : Fr>0

RangeFactorMuHad.guidance:
Set RangeFactor for msc processes of muons/hadrons
Range of parameters : Fr>0

Skin.guidance: Set skin parameter for msc processes

StepLimitMuHad.guidance: Set msc step limitation type for muons/hadrons

ThetaLimit.guidance: Set the limit on the polar angle for msc and single scattering

UseMottCorrection.guidance: Enable usage of Mott corrections for e- elastic scattering

setVerbose.guidance:
Set verbose level for processes
setVerbose level [type or name]
level: verbose level
name : process name
type : process type
[all] for all proceeses

verbose.guidance:
Set Verbose Level for Process Table
verbose [level]
level: verbose level
Range of parameters : verbose >=0

resetEngineFrom.guidance:
Reset the status of the rndm engine from a file.
See CLHEP manual for detail.
The engine status must be stored beforehand.
Directory of the status file should be set by /random/setDirectoryName.

resetEngineFromEachEvent.guidance:
Reset the status of the rndm engine from a file at each event.
Note that the file must follow the following naming convention:
run{#1}evt{#2}.rndm ; where #1 is the run number and #2 is the event number.
For example to re-seed the first event of the first run the file should be called run0evt0.rndm.
If for a specific run/event the file is not found, the standard re-seeding strategy is used.
This command has meaning only in MT mode for strong reproducibility studies.
Directory of the status file should be set by /random/setDirectoryName.

saveEachEventFlag.guidance:
Save random number status at beginning of each event.
File name contains run and event numbers: runXXXevtYYY.rndm

setDirectoryName.guidance:
Define the directory name of the rndm status files.
Directory will be created if it does not exist.

setSavingFlag.guidance:
The randomNumberStatus will be saved at :
begining of run (currentRun.rndm) and begining of event (currentEvent.rndm)

setSeeds.guidance:
Initialize the random number generator with integer seed stream.
Number of integers should be more than 1.
Actual number of integers to be used depends on the individual random number engine.
This command sets the seeds for the master thread.

abort.guidance:
Abort current run processing.
If softAbort is false (default), currently processing event will be immediately aborted,
while softAbort is true, abortion occurs after processing the current event.

beamOn.guidance:
Start a Run.
If G4 kernel is not initialized, it will be initialized.
Default number of events to be processed is 1.
The second and third arguments can be used for
executing a macro file at the end of each event.
If the second argument, i.e. name of the macro
file, is given but the third argument is not,
the macro file will be executed for all of the
event.
If the third argument (nSelect) is given, the
macro file will be executed only for the first
nSelect events.

breakAtBeginOfEvent.guidance: Set a break point at the begining of every event.

breakAtEndOfEvent.guidance: Set a break point at the end of every event.

constructScoringWorlds.guidance:
Constrct scoring parallel world(s) if defined.
This command is not mandatory, but automatically called when a run starts.
But the user may use this to visualize the scoring world(s) before a run to start.

dumpCouples.guidance:
Dump material-cuts-couple information.
Note that material-cuts-couple information is updated
after BeamOn has started.

dumpRegion.guidance:
Dump region information.
In case name of a region is not given, all regions will be displayed.

eventModulo.guidance:
Set the event modulo for dispatching events to worker threads
i.e. each worker thread is ordered to simulate N events and then
comes back to G4MTRunManager for next set.
If it is set to zero (default value), N is roughly given by this.
N = int( sqrt( number_of_events / number_of_threads ) )
The value N may affect on the computing performance in particular
if N is too small compared to the total number of events.
The second parameter seedOnce specifies how frequently each worker
thread is seeded by the random number sequence contrally managed
by the master G4MTRunManager.
- If seedOnce is set to 0 (default), seeds that are centrally managed
by G4MTRunManager are set for every event of every worker thread.
This option guarantees event reproducability regardless of number
of threads.
- If seedOnce is set to 1, seeds are set only once for the first
event of each run of each worker thread. Event reproducability is
guaranteed only if the same number of worker threads are used.
On the other hand, this option offers better computing performance
in particular for applications with relatively small primary
particle energy and large number of events.
- If seedOnce is set to 2, seeds are set only for the first event of
group of N events. This option is reserved for the future use when
Geant4 allows number of threads to be dynatically changed during an
event loop.
This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.
This command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.

geometryModified.guidance:
Force geometry to be closed (re-voxellized) again.
This command must be applied if geometry has been modified
after the first initialization (or BeamOn).

getCutForAGivenParticle.guidance:
Get a cut value to a specific particle
Usage: /run/getCutForAGivenParticle  gamma

numberOfThreads.guidance:
Set the number of threads to be used.
This command works only in PreInit state.
This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.
The command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.
Range of parameters : nThreads >0

optimizeGeometry.guidance:
Set the optimization flag for geometry.
If it is set to TRUE, G4GeometryManager will optimize
the geometry definitions.
GEANT4 is initialized with this flag as TRUE.

addProcManager.guidance: add process manager to specified particle type

applyCuts.guidance:
Set applyCuts flag for a particle.
Some EM processes which do not have infrared divergence
may generate gamma, e- and/or e+ with kinetic energies
below the production threshold. By setting this flag,
such secondaries below threshold are eliminated and
kinetic energies of such secondaries are accumulated
to the energy deposition of their mother.
Note that 'applyCuts' makes sense only for gamma,
e- and e+. If this command is issued for other particle,
a warning message is displayed and the command is
ignored.
If particle name is 'all', this command affects on
gamma, e- and e+.

buildPhysicsTable.guidance: build physics table of specified particle type

dumpCutValues.guidance:
Dump a list of production threshold values in range and energy
for all registered material-cuts-couples.
Dumping a list takes place when you issue 'beamOn' and
actual conversion tables from range to energy are available.
If you want a list 'immediately', use '/run/dumpRegion' for threshold
list given in gange only. Also, '/run/dumpCouples' gives you the
current list if you have already issued 'run/beamOn' at least once.

dumpList.guidance: Dump List of particles in G4VUserPhysicsList.

dumpOrderingParam.guidance: Dump a list of ordering parameter

retrievePhysicsTable.guidance:
Retrieve Physics Table
Enter directory name or OFF to switch off

setStoredInAscii.guidance:
Switch on/off ascii mode in store/retreive Physics Table
Enter 0(binary) or 1(ascii)
Range of parameters : ascii ==0 || ascii ==1

storePhysicsTable.guidance:
Store Physics Table
Enter directory name

verbose.guidance:
Set the Verbose level of G4VUserPhysicsList.
0 : Silent (default)
1 : Display warning messages
2 : Display more
Range of parameters : level >=0 && level <=3

physicsModified.guidance:
Force all physics tables recalculated again.
This command must be applied
if physics process has been modified after the
first initialization (or BeamOn).

pinAffinity.guidance:
Locks each thread to a specific logical core. Workers are locked in round robin to logical cores.
This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.
This command works only in PreInit state.
This command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.
If a value n>0 is provided it starts setting affinity from the n-th CPU (note: counting from 1).
E.g. /run/pinAffinity 3 locks first thread on third logical CPU (number 2).
If a value n<0 is provided never locks on n-th CPU.
Range of parameters : pinAffinity > 0 || pinAffinity < 0

printProgress.guidance:
Display begin_of_event information at given frequency.
If it is set to zero, only the begin_of_run is shown.
If it is set to -1, no print-out is shown.
Range of parameters : mod>=-1

reinitializeGeometry.guidance:
Force geometry to be rebuilt once again.
This command must be applied if the user needs his/her
detector construction to be reinvoked.
/run/geometryModified is automatically issued with this command.

setCut.guidance:
Set default cut value
Range of parameters : cut >=0.0

setCutForAGivenParticle.guidance:
Set a cut value to a specific particle
Usage: /run/setCutForAGivenParticle  gamma  1. mm

setCutForRegion.guidance: Set cut value for a region

storeRndmStatToEvent.guidance:
Flag to store rndm status to G4Event object.
flag = 0 : not store (default)
flag = 1 : status before primary particle generation is stored
flag = 2 : status before event processing (after primary particle generation) is stored
flag = 3 : both are stored
Note: Some performance overhead may be seen by storing rndm status, in particular
for the case of simplest geometry and small number of tracks per event.
Range of parameters : flag>=0 && flag<3

useMaximumLogicalCores.guidance:
Set the number of threads to be the number of available logical cores.
This command works only in PreInit state.
This command is valid only for multi-threaded mode.
The command is ignored if it is issued in sequential mode.

verbose.guidance:
Set the Verbose level of G4RunManager.
0 : Silent (default)
1 : Display main topics
2 : Display main topics and run summary
Range of parameters : level >=0 && level <=2

storeTrajectory.guidance:
Store trajectories or not.
0 : Don't Store trajectories.
!=0 : Store trajectories.
1 : Choose G4Trajectory as default.
2 : Choose G4SmoothTrajectory as default.
3 : Choose G4RichTrajectory as default.
4 : Choose G4RichTrajectory with auxiliary points as default.
Range of parameters : Store >=0 && Store <= 4

verbose.guidance:
Set Verbose level of tracking category.
-1 : Silent.
0 : Silent.
1 : Minium information of each Step.
2 : Addition to Level=1, info of secondary particles.
3 : Addition to Level=1, pre/postStepoint information
after all AlongStep/PostStep process executions.
4 : Addition to Level=3, pre/postStepoint information
at each AlongStepPostStep process execuation.
5 : Addition to Level=4, proposed Step length information
from each AlongStepPostStep process.
Range of parameters : verbose_level >=-1

<  10: - does not print daughters of repeated placements, does not repeat replicas.
>= 10: prints all physical volumes.
The level of detail is given by verbosity%10:
for each volume:
>=  0: physical volume name.
>=  1: logical volume name (and names of sensitive detector and readout geometry, if any).
>=  2: solid name and type.
>=  3: volume and density.
>=  5: daughter-subtracted volume and mass.
>=  6: physical volume dump.
>=  7: polyhedron dump.
and in the summary at the end of printing:
>=  4: daughter-included mass of top physical volume(s) in scene to depth specified.
Note: by default, culling is switched off so all volumes are seen.
Note: the mass calculation takes into account daughters, which can be time consuming.  If you want the mass of a particular subtree to a particular depth:
/vis/open ATree
/vis/ASCIITree/verbose 14
/vis/scene/create
/vis/scene/add/volume <subtree-physical-volume> ! <depth>
/vis/sceneHandler/attach
/vis/viewer/flush
Note: dumping the physical volumes produces a lot of output. It is advisable to select the volume of interest, as for a sub-tree above.

drawTree.guidance:
(DTREE) Creates a scene consisting of this physical volume and
  produces a representation of the geometry hieracrhy.
The scene becomes current.

drawView.guidance: Draw view from this angle, etc.

drawVolume.guidance:
Creates a scene containing this physical volume and asks the
current viewer to draw it.  The scene becomes current.
If physical-volume-name is "world" (the default), the main geometry
tree (material world) is drawn.  If "worlds", all worlds - material
world and parallel worlds, if any - are drawn.  Otherwise a search of
all worlds is made, taking the first matching occurence only.  To see
a representation of the geometry hierarchy of the worlds, try
"/vis/drawTree [worlds]" or one of the driver/browser combinations
that have the required functionality, e.g., HepRep

attributeFilter.guidance:
Create a attributeFilter model and associated messengers.
Generated model becomes current.

Create a attributeFilter model and associated messengers.
Generated model becomes current.

Create a attributeFilter model and associated messengers.
Generated model becomes current.

chargeFilter.guidance:
Create a chargeFilter model and associated messengers.
Generated model becomes current.

originVolumeFilter.guidance:
Create a originVolumeFilter model and associated messengers.
Generated model becomes current.

particleFilter.guidance:
Create a particleFilter model and associated messengers.
Generated model becomes current.

addHitName.guidance: hit name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.

addHitScorerName.guidance: hit scorer name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.

addPointAttributes.guidance: Adds point attributes to the points of trajectories.

appendGeometry.guidance: Appends copy of geometry to every event.

setEventNumberSuffix.guidance:
Write separate event files, appended with given suffix.
Define the suffix with a pattern such as '-0000'.

setScoringMeshName.guidance: scoring mesh name for a dose distribution in gMocren data.

setVolumeName.guidance: detector name for a volume data in gMocren data.

useSolids.guidance: Use GMocren Solids, rather than Geant4 Primitives.

list.guidance:
Lists vis attributes of logical volume(s).
"all" lists all logical volumes.

restore.guidance: Restores vis attributes of logical volume(s).

colour.guidance:
Sets colour of logical volume(s).
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

daughtersInvisible.guidance:
Makes daughters of logical volume(s) invisible.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceAuxEdgeVisible.guidance:
Forces auxiliary (soft) edges of logical volume(s) to be visible,
regardless of the view parameters.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceLineSegmentsPerCircle.guidance:
Forces number of line segments per circle, the precision with which a
curved line or surface is represented by a polygon or polyhedron,
regardless of the view parameters.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceSolid.guidance:
Forces logical volume(s) always to be drawn solid (surface drawing),
regardless of the view parameters.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

forceWireframe.guidance:
Forces logical volume(s) always to be drawn as wireframe,
regardless of the view parameters.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

lineStyle.guidance:
Sets line style of logical volume(s) drawing.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

lineWidth.guidance:
Sets line width of logical volume(s) drawing.
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

visibility.guidance:
Sets visibility of logical volume(s).
"all" sets all logical volumes.
Optionally propagates down hierarchy to given depth.

addPointAttributes.guidance:
Adds point attributes to the points of trajectories.
This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile.

appendGeometry.guidance:
Appends copy of geometry to every event.
This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile.

renderCylAsPolygons.guidance:
Render cylinders and cones as polygons.
This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

scale.guidance:
Re-Scale coordinates.
Range of parameters : Scale > 0

setCullInvisibles.guidance:
Remove invisible objects from output file.
This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setEventNumberSuffix.guidance:
Write separate event files, appended with given suffix.
Define the suffix with a pattern such as '-0000'.
This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile.

setFileDir.guidance:
Set directory for output.
This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setFileName.guidance:
Set file name for output.
This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

setOverwrite.guidance:
Set true to write all output to exact same file name.
Set false to increment the file name for each new output.
This command is used by HepRepFile, not by HepRepXML.

useSolids.guidance:
Use HepRep Solids, rather than Geant4 Primitives.
This command is used by HepRepXML, not by HepRepFile..

setAuxPtsColourRGBA.guidance:
Set colour through red, green, blue and alpha components
Four inputs are expected.

setLineColourRGBA.guidance:
Set colour through red, green, blue and alpha components
Four inputs are expected.

setStepPtsColourRGBA.guidance:
Set colour through red, green, blue and alpha components
Four inputs are expected.

setTimeSliceInterval.guidance: Set time slice interval.  Give unit, e.g., "0.1 ns"

actionOnEventQueueFull.guidance:
When event queue for drawing gets full:
wait: event processing waits for vis manager to catch up.
discard: events are discarded for drawing.

maxEventQueueSize.guidance:
Defines maximum event queue size. N <=0 means "unlimited".
If adding an event to the visualisation event queue would cause the queue size to exceed this value:
if actionOnEventQueueFull==wait the worker threads are paused for a short time to give the visualisation manager a chance to catch up.
if actionOnEventQueueFull==discard the event is discarded for drawing.

export.guidance:
export a screenshot of current OpenGL viewer
If name is "", filename and extension will have the default value
If name is "toto.png", set the name to "toto" and the format to "png". No incremented suffix is added.
If name is "toto", set the name to "toto" and the format to default (or current format if specify). Will also add an incremented suffix at the end of the file, except if name is the same as previous it will not reset incremented suffix.
Setting size is available only on eps/pdf/svg/ps formats

printEPS.guidance:
Print Encapsulated PostScript file.
Generates files with names G4OpenGL_n.eps, where n is a sequence
number, starting at 0.
Can be "vectored" or "pixmap" - see "/vis/ogl/set/printMode".

displayHeadTime.guidance: Display head time of range in 2D text.

displayLightFront.guidance:
Display the light front at head time.
Tip: The trajectories can appear of jump ahead of the light front
because their time range overlaps the viewer's time range.  To
average out this discrete time effect, advance the light front by
half the trajectories interval. E.g., if the trajectory time slice
interval is 0.01 ns:
  /vis/ogl/set/displayLightFront true -90 0 0 mm -0.005 ns
To prevent them beating the light front at all:
  /vis/ogl/set/displayLightFront true -90 0 0 mm -0.01 ns

displayListLimit.guidance:
Set/reset display list limit (to avoid memory exhaustion).
Range of parameters : limit>=10000

endTime.guidance: Set end and range of track time.

eventsDrawInterval.guidance:
Set number of events allowed in drawing pipeline - speeds drawing
By default, the screen is updated at the end of every event.
Allowing OpenGL to buffer several events can make a big improvement
in drawing speed.

exportFormat.guidance:
Set export format
By default, pdf/eps/svg/ps are available. Depending of viewers several other format are available.
Try /vis/ogl/set/exportFormat without parameters to see them.
Changing format will reset the incremental suffix to 0.

fade.guidance:
0: no fade; 1: maximum fade with time within range.
Range of parameters : fadefactor>=0.&&fadefactor<=1.

printFilename.guidance:
Set print filename
Setting 'incremental' will increment filename by one at each new print, starting at 0

printMode.guidance: Set print mode, only available for "ps" format

printSize.guidance:
Set print size
Tip : -1 will mean 'print size' = 'window size'
Setting size greatter than your maximum graphic card capacity , will set the size to maximum  size.

startTime.guidance: Set start and range of track time.

transparency.guidance: True/false to enable/disable rendering of transparent objects.

open.guidance:
Creates a scene handler ready for drawing.
The scene handler becomes current (the name is auto-generated).

attenuation.guidance:
Define the attenuation length for transparent material.
Note that this value is independent to the attenuation length for the optical photon processes.
Range of parameters : Length > 0.

backgroundColour.guidance: Command has been deprecated.  Use /vis/viewer/set/background instead.

column.guidance:
Define the number of horizontal pixels.
Range of parameters : nPixel > 0

distortion.guidance: Distortion effect of the fish eye lens.

eyePosition.guidance:
Define the eye position.
Eye direction is calsurated from (target - eyePosition).

headAngle.guidance:
Define the head direction.
Range of parameters : headAngle>=0. && headAngle<360.

ignoreTransparency.guidance: Ignore transparency even if the alpha of G4Colour < 1.

lightDirection.guidance:
Define the direction of illumination light.
The vector needs not to be a unit vector, but it must not be a zero vector.
Range of parameters : Px != 0 || Py != 0 || Pz != 0

row.guidance:
Define the number of virtical pixels.
Range of parameters : nPixel > 0

span.guidance:
Define the angle per 100 pixels.
Range of parameters : span>0.

target.guidance: Define the center position of the target.

trace.guidance:
Start the ray tracing.
Define the name of output JPEG file.

reviewKeptEvents.guidance:
Review kept events.
If a macro file is specified, it is executed for each event.
If a macro file is not specified, each event is drawn to the current
viewer.  After each event, the session is paused.  The user may issue
any allowed command.  Then enter "cont[inue]" to continue to the next
event.
Useful commands might be:
  "/vis/viewer/..." to change the view (zoom, set/viewpoint,...).
  "/vis/oglx/printEPS" to get hard copy.
  "/vis/open" to get alternative viewer.
  "/vis/abortReviewKeptEvents", then "cont[inue]", to abort.

activateModel.guidance:
Activate or de-activate model.
Attempts to match search string to name of model - use unique sub-string.
Use "/vis/scene/list" to see model names.
If name == "all" (default), all models are activated.

axes.guidance:
Add axes.
Draws axes at (x0, y0, z0) of given length and colour.
If "unitcolour" is "auto", x, y and z will be red, green and blue
  respectively.  Otherwise choose from the pre-defined text-specified
  colours - see information printed by the vis manager at start-up or
  use "/vis/list".
If "length" is negative, it is set to about 25% of scene extent.
If "showtext" is false, annotations are suppressed.

date.guidance:
Adds date to current scene.
If "date"is omitted, the current date and time is drawn.
Otherwise, the string, including the rest of the line, is drawn.

digis.guidance:
Adds digis to current scene.
Digis are drawn at end of event when the scene in which
they are added is current.

eventID.guidance:
Adds eventID to current scene.
Run and event numbers are drawn at end of event or run when
 the scene in which they are added is current.

extent.guidance:
Adds a dummy model with given extent to the current scene.
Requires the limits: xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, zmin, zmax unit.
This can be used to provide an extent to the scene even if
no other models with extent are available. For example,
even if there is no geometry.  In that case, for example:
  /vis/open OGL
  /vis/scene/create
  /vis/scene/add/extent -300 300 -300 300 -300 300 cm
  /vis/sceneHandler/attach

hits.guidance:
Adds hits to current scene.
Hits are drawn at end of event when the scene in which
they are added is current.

logicalVolume.guidance:
Adds a logical volume to the current scene,
Shows boolean components (if any), voxels (if any) and readout geometry
(if any).  Note: voxels are not constructed until start of run -
 "/run/beamOn".  (For voxels without a run, "/run/beamOn 0".)

logo.guidance:
Adds a G4 logo to the current scene.
If "unit" is "auto", height is roughly one tenth of scene extent.
"direction" is that of outward-facing normal to front face of logo.
If "direction" is "auto", logo faces the user in the current viewer.
If "placement" is "auto", logo is placed at bottom right of screen
  when viewed from logo direction.

magneticField.guidance:
Adds magnetic field representation to current scene.
The first parameter is no. of data points per half scene.  So, possibly, at
maximum, the number of data points sampled is (2*n+1)^3, which can grow
large--be warned!
You might find that your scene is cluttered by thousands of arrows for
the default number of data points, so try reducing to 2 or 3, e.g:
  /vis/scene/add/magneticField 3
or, if only a small part of the scene has a field:
  /vis/scene/add/magneticField 50 # or more
In the arrow representation, the length of the arrow is proportional
to the magnitude of the field and the colour is mapped onto the range
as a fraction of the maximum magnitude: 0->0.5->1 is blue->green->red.

psHits.guidance:
Adds Primitive Scorer Hits (PSHits) to current scene.
PSHits are drawn at end of run when the scene in which
they are added is current.
Optional parameter specifies name of scoring map.  By default all
scoring maps registered with the G4ScoringManager are drawn.

text.guidance:
Adds text to current scene.
Use "/vis/set/textColour" to set colour.
Use "/vis/set/textLayout" to set layout:

text2D.guidance:
Adds 2D text to current scene.
Use "/vis/set/textColour" to set colour.
Use "/vis/set/textLayout" to set layout:

trajectories.guidance:
Adds trajectories to current scene.
Causes trajectories, if any, to be drawn at the end of processing an
event.  Switches on trajectory storing and sets the
default trajectory type.
The command line parameter list determines the default trajectory type.
If it contains the string "smooth", auxiliary inter-step points will
be inserted to improve the smoothness of the drawing of a curved
trajectory.
If it contains the string "rich", significant extra information will
be stored in the trajectory (G4RichTrajectory) amenable to modeling
and filtering with "/vis/modeling/trajectories/create/drawByAttribute"
and "/vis/filtering/trajectories/create/attributeFilter" commands.
It may contain both strings in any order.
To switch off trajectory storing: "/tracking/storeTrajectory 0".
See also "/vis/scene/endOfEventAction".
Note:  This only sets the default.  Independently of the result of this
command, a user may instantiate a trajectory that overrides this default
in PreUserTrackingAction.

userAction.guidance:
Add named Vis User Action to current scene.
Attempts to match search string to name of action - use unique sub-string.
(Use /vis/list to see names of registered actions.)
If name == "all" (default), all actions are added.

volume.guidance:
Adds a physical volume to current scene, with optional clipping volume.
If physical-volume-name is "world" (the default), the top of the
main geometry tree (material world) is added.  If "worlds", the
top of all worlds - material world and parallel worlds, if any - are
added.  Otherwise a search of all worlds is made, taking the first
matching occurence only.  To see a representation of the geometry
hierarchy of the worlds, try "/vis/drawTree [worlds]" or one of the
driver/browser combinations that have the required functionality, e.g., HepRep.
If clip-volume-type is specified, the subsequent parameters are used to
to define a clipping volume.  For example,
"/vis/scene/add/volume ! ! ! -box km 0 1 0 1 0 1" will draw the world
with the positive octant cut away.  (If the Boolean Processor issues
warnings try replacing 0 by 0.000000001 or something.)
If clip-volume-type is prepended with '-', the clip-volume is subtracted
(cutaway). (This is the default if there is no prepended character.)
If '*' is prepended, the intersection of the physical-volume and the
clip-volume is made. (You can make a section/DCUT with a thin box, for
example).
For "box", the parameters are xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,zmin,zmax.
Only "box" is programmed at present.

create.guidance:
Creates an empty scene.
Invents a name if not supplied.  This scene becomes current.

endOfEventAction.guidance:
Accumulate or refresh the viewer for each new event.
"accumulate": viewer accumulates hits, etc., event by event, or
"refresh": viewer shows them at end of event or, for direct-screen
  viewers, refreshes the screen just before drawing the next event.

endOfRunAction.guidance:
Accumulate or refresh the viewer for each new run.
"accumulate": viewer accumulates hits, etc., run by run, or
"refresh": viewer shows them at end of run or, for direct-screen
  viewers, refreshes the screen just before drawing the first
  event of the next run.
The detector remains or is redrawn.

list.guidance:
Lists scene(s).
"help /vis/verbose" for definition of verbosity.

notifyHandlers.guidance:
Notifies scene handlers and forces re-rendering.
Notifies the handler(s) of the specified scene and forces a
reconstruction of any graphical databases.
Clears and refreshes all viewers of current scene.
  The default action "refresh" does not issue "update" (see
    /vis/viewer/update).
If "flush" is specified, it issues an "update" as well as
  "refresh" - "update" and initiates post-processing
  for graphics systems which need it.
The default for <scene-name> is the current scene name.
This command does not change current scene, scene handler or viewer.

select.guidance:
Selects a scene
Makes the scene current.  "/vis/scene/list" to see
 possible scene names.

attach.guidance:
Attaches scene to current scene handler.
If scene-name is omitted, current scene is attached.  To see scenes and
scene handlers, use "/vis/scene/list" and "/vis/sceneHandler/list"

create.guidance:
Creates an scene handler for a specific graphics system.
Attaches current scene, if any.  (You can change attached scenes with
"/vis/sceneHandler/attach".)  Invents a scene handler name if not
supplied.  This scene handler becomes current.

list.guidance:
Lists scene handler(s).
"help /vis/verbose" for definition of verbosity.

select.guidance:
Selects a scene handler.
Makes the scene handler current.  "/vis/sceneHandler/list" to see
 possible scene handler names.

colour.guidance:
Defines colour and opacity for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.
(Except "/vis/scene/add/text" commands - see "/vis/set/textColour".)
Default: white and opaque.

lineWidth.guidance:
Defines line width for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.
Range of parameters : lineWidth >= 1.

textColour.guidance:
Defines colour and opacity for future "/vis/scene/add/text" commands.
Default: blue and opaque.

textLayout.guidance:
Defines layout future "/vis/scene/add/text" commands.
"left" (default) for left justification to provided coordinate.
"centre" or "center" for text centered on provided coordinate.
"right" for right justification to provided coordinate.
Default: left.

textSize.guidance:
Defines text size (pixels) for future "/vis/scene/add/" commands.
Range of parameters : textSize >= 1.

touchable.guidance:
Defines touchable for future "/vis/touchable/set/" commands.
Please provide a list of space-separated physical volume names and
copy number pairs starting at the world volume, e.g:
  /vis/set/touchable World 0 Envelope 0 Shape1 0
(To get list of touchables, use "/vis/drawTree")
(To save, use "/vis/viewer/save")

specify.guidance:
Draws logical volume with Boolean components, voxels and readout geometry.
Creates a scene consisting of this logical volume and asks the
  current viewer to draw it to the specified depth of descent
  showing boolean components (if any), voxels (if any)
  and readout geometry (if any), under control of the appropriate flag.
Note: voxels are not constructed until start of run - /run/beamOn.
The scene becomes current.

dump.guidance:
Dump touchable attributes.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

colour.guidance:
Set colour of current touchable.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.
If "red" is a string understood by the vis system it will be taken.
  Otherwise the values of
ed", "green", etc., are used.

daughtersInvisible.guidance:
Daughters of current touchable invisible: true/false.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

forceAuxEdgeVisible.guidance:
Force auxiliary (soft) edges of current touchable to be visible: true/false.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

forceSolid.guidance:
Force current touchable always to be drawn solid (surface drawing).
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

forceWireframe.guidance:
Force current touchable always to be drawn as wireframe.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

lineSegmentsPerCircle.guidance:
For current touchable, set number of line segments per circle, the
precision with which a curved line or surface is represented by a
polygon or polyhedron, regardless of the view parameters.
Negative to pick up G4Polyhedron default value.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

lineStyle.guidance:
Set line style of current touchable drawing.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

lineWidth.guidance:
Set line width of current touchable.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

visibility.guidance:
Set visibility of current touchable: true/false.
Use "/vis/set/touchable" to set current touchable.

verbose.guidance:
Simple graded message scheme - digit or string (1st character defines):
0) quiet,          Nothing is printed.
1) startup,        Startup and endup messages are printed...
2) errors,         ...and errors...
3) warnings,       ...and warnings...
4) confirmations,  ...and confirming messages...
5) parameters,     ...and parameters of scenes and views...
6) all             ...and everything available.

addCutawayPlane.guidance: Add cutaway plane to current viewer.

clear.guidance:
Clears viewer.
By default, clears current viewer.  Specified viewer becomes current.
"/vis/viewer/list" to see  possible viewer names.

clearCutawayPlanes.guidance: Clear cutaway planes of current viewer.

clearTransients.guidance:
Clears transients from viewer.
By default, operates on current viewer.  Specified viewer becomes current.
"/vis/viewer/list" to see  possible viewer names.

clone.guidance:
Clones viewer.
By default, clones current viewer.  Clone becomes current.
Clone name, if not provided, is derived from the original name.
"/vis/viewer/list" to see  possible viewer names.

copyViewFrom.guidance:
Copy the camera-specific parameters from the specified viewer.
Note: To copy scene modifications - style, etc. - please use
"/vis/viewer/set/all"

create.guidance:
Creates a viewer for the specified scene handler.
Default scene handler is the current scene handler.  Invents a name
if not supplied.  (Note: the system adds information to the name
for identification - only the characters up to the first blank are
used for removing, selecting, etc.)  This scene handler and viewer
become current.

hiddenEdge.guidance:
Default hiddenEdge drawing for future viewers.
Edges become hidden/seen in wireframe or surface mode.

style.guidance:
Default drawing style for future viewers.
Set style of drawing - w[ireframe] or s[urface].
(Default hidden line drawing is controlled by "/vis/viewer/default/hiddenEdge".)

dolly.guidance:
Incremental dolly.
Moves the camera incrementally towards target point.

dollyTo.guidance:
Dolly to specific coordinate.
Places the camera towards target point relative to standard camera point.

flush.guidance:
Compound command: "/vis/viewer/refresh" + "/vis/viewer/update".
Useful for refreshing and initiating post-processing for graphics
systems which need post-processing.  By default, acts on current
viewer.  "/vis/viewer/list" to see possible viewers.  Viewer
becomes current.

list.guidance:
Lists viewers(s).
See "/vis/verbose" for definition of verbosity.

pan.guidance:
Incremental pan.
Moves the camera incrementally right and up by these amounts (as seen
from viewpoint direction).

panTo.guidance:
Pan to specific coordinate.
Places the camera in this position right and up relative to standard
target point (as seen from viewpoint direction).

rebuild.guidance:
Forces rebuild of graphical database.
By default, acts on current viewer.  "/vis/viewer/list"
to see possible viewers.  Viewer becomes current.

refresh.guidance:
Refreshes viewer.
By default, acts on current viewer.  "/vis/viewer/list"
to see possible viewers.  Viewer becomes current.

reset.guidance:
Resets viewer.
By default, acts on current viewer.  "/vis/viewer/list"
to see possible viewers.  Viewer becomes current.

save.guidance:
Write commands that define the current view to file.
Read them back into the same or any viewer with "/control/execute <filename>".

scale.guidance:
Incremental (non-uniform) scaling.
Multiplies components of current scaling by components of this factor.
 Scales (x,y,z) by corresponding components of the resulting factor.

scaleTo.guidance:
Absolute (non-uniform) scaling.
Scales (x,y,z) by corresponding components of this factor.

select.guidance:
Selects viewer.
Specify viewer by name.  "/vis/viewer/list" to see possible viewers.

all.guidance:
Copies view parameters.
Copies view parameters (except the autoRefresh status) from
from-viewer to current viewer.

autoRefresh.guidance:
Sets auto-refresh.
If true, view is automatically refreshed after a change of
view parameters.

auxiliaryEdge.guidance:
Sets visibility of auxiliary edges
Auxiliary edges, i.e., those that are part of a curved surface,
sometimes called soft edges, become visible/invisible.

background.guidance:
Set background colour and transparency (default black and opaque).
Accepts (a) RGB triplet. e.g., ".3 .4 .5", or
(b) string such as "white", "black", "grey", "red"...
(c) an additional number for opacity, e.g., ".3 .4 .5 .6"
    or "grey ! ! .6" (note "!"'s for unused green and blue parameters),
    e.g. "! ! ! 0." for a transparent background.

culling.guidance:
Set culling options.
"global": enables/disables all other culling options.
"coveredDaughters": culls, i.e., eliminates, volumes that would not
be seen because covered by ancester volumes in surface drawing mode,
and then only if the ancesters are visible and opaque, and then only
if no sections or cutaways are in operation.  Intended solely to
improve the speed of rendering visible volumes.
"invisible": culls objects with the invisible attribute set.
"density": culls volumes with density lower than threshold.  Useful
for eliminating "container volumes" with no physical correspondence,
whose material is usually air.  If this is selected, provide threshold
density and unit (g/cm3 mg/cm3 or kg/m3).

cutawayMode.guidance: Sets cutaway mode - add (union) or multiply (intersection).

defaultColour.guidance:
Set defaultColour colour and transparency (default white and opaque).
Accepts (a) RGB triplet. e.g., ".3 .4 .5", or
(b) string such as "white", "black", "grey", "red"...
(c) an additional number for opacity, e.g., ".3 .4 .5 .6"
    or "grey ! ! .6" (note "!"'s for unused green and blue parameters),
    e.g. "! ! ! 0." for a transparent colour.

defaultTextColour.guidance:
Set defaultTextColour colour and transparency (default white and opaque).
Accepts (a) RGB triplet. e.g., ".3 .4 .5", or
(b) string such as "white", "black", "grey", "red"...
(c) an additional number for opacity, e.g., ".3 .4 .5 .6"
    or "grey ! ! .6" (note "!"'s for unused green and blue parameters),
    e.g. "! ! ! 0." for a transparent colour.

edge.guidance: Edges become visible/invisible in surface mode.

explodeFactor.guidance: Moves top-level drawn volumes by this factor from this centre.

globalLineWidthScale.guidance: Multiplies line widths by this factor.

globalMarkerScale.guidance: Multiplies marker sizes by this factor.

hiddenEdge.guidance: Edges become hidden/seen in wireframe or surface mode.

hiddenMarker.guidance: If true, closer objects hide markers. Otherwise, markers always show.

lightsMove.guidance: Lights move with camera or with object

lightsThetaPhi.guidance: Set direction from target to lights.

lightsVector.guidance: Set direction from target to lights.

lineSegmentsPerCircle.guidance:
Set number of sides per circle for polygon/polyhedron drawing.
Refers to graphical representation of objects with curved lines/surfaces.

picking.guidance:
Sets picking, if available.
If true, view is set up for picking, if available.
You may need to issue "/vis/viewer/update".
For required actions, watch for instructions for viewer.

projection.guidance:
Set projection style - o[rthogonal] or p[erspective].
If p[erspective], also set field half angle.

rotationStyle.guidance:
Set style of rotation - constrainUpDirection or freeRotation.
constrainUpDirection: conventional HEP view.
freeRotation: Google-like rotation, using mouse-grab.

sectionPlane.guidance:
Set plane for drawing section (DCUT).
E.g., for a y-z plane at x = 1 cm:
"/vis/viewer/set/sectionPlane on 1 0 0 cm 1 0 0".
To turn off: /vis/viewer/set/sectionPlane off

style.guidance:
Set style of drawing - w[ireframe] or s[urface].
(Hidden line drawing is controlled by "/vis/viewer/set/hiddenEdge".)

targetPoint.guidance:
Set target point.
This sets the "Current Target Point" relative to the "Standard
Target Point" so that the actual target point is as requested.
(See G4ViewParameters.hh for an explanation of target points.)

upThetaPhi.guidance:
Set up vector.
Viewer will attempt always to show this direction upwards.

upVector.guidance:
Set up vector.
Viewer will attempt always to show this direction upwards.

viewpointThetaPhi.guidance:
Set direction from target to camera.
Also changes lightpoint direction if lights are set to move with camera.

viewpointVector.guidance:
Set direction from target to camera.
Also changes lightpoint direction if lights are set to move with camera.

update.guidance:
Triggers graphical database post-processing for viewers
using that technique.
For such viewers the view only becomes visible with this command.
By default, acts on current viewer.  "/vis/viewer/list"
to see possible viewers.  Viewer becomes current.

zoom.guidance:
Incremental zoom.
Multiplies current magnification by this factor.

zoomTo.guidance:
Absolute zoom.
Magnifies standard magnification by this factor.
